intro: Sloanea picapica, commonly known as the Andean sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes plants known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sloanea picapica produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often accompanied by specialized structures called cyathia.
